name: Hotel Lindrum Melbourne-MGallery Collection

reviews.title: Nice boutique hotel on the fringe of the CBD
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Lindrum while in town for business. It's a great little property, a nice change from a larger chain hotel. It's got character, and is centrally located for the most part. Be sure to check out some of the great nearby restaurants on Flinders Lane- Coda and Cumulus come to mind. It's very close to some of the city's best green spaces-parks and gardens. If you're traveling in good weather, you're sure to take advantage of it. The staff was very friendly, but seemingly not that knowledgeable on the city, overall, which tends to be the norm in Melbourne. The rooms were spacious, and the bed is VERY comfy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They don't have a gym, unfortunately, but there's a Virgin gym nearby. And, lastly, the wi-fi only works from the common area (lobby). Although they do have dsl in the room, it's quite slow. Overall, a nice place!
reviews.title: A very cosy, boutique hotel, perfect for a winter getaway

reviews.text: The Lindrum is a very cute, unique building on Flinders Street. It is different from all the 'big' hotel chains and that's what made our stay so special here. The service was outstanding the whole visit through. Ben gave us an excellent place to have a delicious breakfast, in one of the little laneways near Flinders Station. All the staff were friendly and answered all our questions happily. The location was perfect, walking distance to many major city attractions and the free City Tram departs out the front to take you on a tour around the lovely city. I advise getting a Queen Deluxe Superior Room on the upper levels, as these are the ones with a gorgeous view of Melbourne. The other rooms seem to have no view at all (only of a carpark). It was so nice to wake up to the sight of a tram whizzing by on the streets below. The fireplace and snooker table located on the ground floor, added warmth to the hotel and the extra comfy longes with beautiful cushions were a welcome treat after a day of walking around the city streets. The bed was soft and comfortable and the bathroom had such lovely big mirrors. The wooden floorboards throughout the building add a rustic feel and charm to the hotel. The entrance door is really something else! Room service meals were scrumptious too. Don't bother coming if you want a gym, swimmming pool and all that jazz. This is more of a hotel to relax and chill out and use as a base for exploring Melbourne city. Highly recommended for a winter getaway, personal and friendly service and a cosy place to stay. We will be back.
reviews.title: Stylish Boutique Hotel - some disappointments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I love the Hotel Lindrum and have stayed about 5 times. The staff, location and ambience make it a great place to stay. A good choice if you like something a bit more individual and find the major chain hotels soul-less. But I had a couple of disappointments this time.
reviews.title: pleasant but over-rated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a very noisy function on Friday evening that went beyond 12.30am and the noise floats right up from the lobby stairwell. We were not forewarned, although staff were very apologetic the next day, and assured us it was unusual.
reviews.title: Cannot believe the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel, rooms and location are all spot on... but there is something about this place that just doesn't match up. I think it is lacking in the service department and doesn't quite fit the bill when it comes to rating themselves as a 5 star hotel. For example there is no moisturiser in the rooms (only a small tube of face moisturiser) and the service is a little off. We were after breakfast on Good Friday and it seemed like a bit of a mission to get us some toast after the breakfast buffet ended. Would I stay here again, for the right price yes but when compared to places like the hyatt it just isn't good enough.
reviews.title: Probably wouldn't go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at hotel Lindrum recently as we wanted a good hotel within walking distance to the MCG and everywhere else was fully booked. The hotel is quite nice, boutique style, but realistically it is very overpriced. Whilst the staff were efficient we did not find them particually inviting. In fact the atmosphere was all a bit cold. If you can get a good budget deal I would recommend but don't pay the standard rate here - I wished we had paid less and walked further for our accommodation.
reviews.title: nice hotel but overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights in room 311 at an average cost of 235 AUD. The location is perfect, right in the city center. We loved the architecture of the building and the fact that our room was spacious with high ceiling. The bed was amazingly comfortable: king size, great pillows and nice sheets. We really loved the service provided by the staff, very professional and always looking to improve your experience. The ground floor area – reception desk, restaurant, bar - was very lively.
reviews.title: Fantastic boutique hotel in Melbourne city center + great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a les positive note, our room had absolutely no views of the city – our window was facing a parking lot. The wired internet connection was very slow.
reviews.title: Very Cool Boutique Hotel

reviews.title: Unique, boutique hotel - excellent rooms, service and location.
